page.title: 015Km North of Horsham
page.content: This block of rich, green countryside contains ten farms. Most of the Fields are used for grazing sheep and cows, though many fields did not have animals on at the time of the survey. Much of the remaining land has a fairly dense coverage of deciduous trees. The area has many small hills and dales, offering several views of a few square kilometres. A part from scatttered farm buildings and the two pubs there are few houses. A nunnery was hidden away in an extensive enclosed area of well kept gardens. Two main single crriage-way roads go through this block. (24, A29) all other routes are country lanes bordered by trees or tall, thick hedges with no pavement. Some are simple tracks of stones and gravel or entrances on private property.
